content:
advertisement

The attorney of a Penn State student who police say plotted to kill a police informant is asking a judge to throw out his case on grounds of entrapment PERIOD

Defense attorney Karen Muir said she believes police encouraged 24yearold boxer Katongo Mulenga to hire an undercover officer as a hitman overreaching their bounds PERIOD

While incarcerated at the Centre County Correctional Facility police said Michael P PERIOD Alexander asked Mulenga to hire a hitman to kill the police informant who helped land Alexander in jail on drugrelated charges PERIOD

Alexander then gave Mulengas contact information to an undercover state trooper and wrote that Mulenga would pay him for the murder police said PERIOD

 Muir said PERIOD 

The Zambia native  known to his friends and coaches as   was charged with criminal conspiracy to commit murder and criminal use of a communication facility police said PERIOD

Centre County District Attorney Michael Madeira said Muirs entrapment defense doesnt hold water because it wasnt the police who got Mulenga involved PERIOD

 Madeira said PERIOD 

Madeira said he doesnt believe the defense attorney met her burden to show that police entrapped Mulenga PERIOD He added Mulengas intent to commit the crime was obvious through various phone calls and letters from jail PERIOD

A Centre County Correctional Facility inmate reported to authorities last March that Alexander asked him if he knew of anyone for hire police said PERIOD

Alexander is now charged with criminal solicitation to commit murder and criminal use of a communication facility after police say he communicated with an undercover state trooper known to him as  through written letters about hiring and making a down payment to a hitman PERIOD

In a letter police say Alexander told  that it was  so he provided  with his friends information which turned out to be Mulenga PERIOD

Madeira said Centre County Judge David E PERIOD Grine didnt come to a ruling on Muirs request at Tuesdays 20minute court hearing PERIOD Alexander and Mulenga are scheduled for jury selection in December PERIOD
